attributes.action: Stop Cruise Liners Coming into Orkney During the Coronavirus Outbreak
attributes.additional_details: There is a liner due in on Saturday 14th of march, stopping at shetland 1st who have confirmed cases of the virus.  Cruise ships are small confined spaces with large numbers of people on board being the perfect spreading haven.  Prevent is better than cure.  This is similar to large organised events so something must be done to protect our communities. This is happening now.  Please act before it's too late.
attributes.background:
We want you to stop all cruise liners coming into Orkney during the Coronavirus outbreak.  
There are people from all over on these liners and the results could be devastating to such a small community.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300932

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
